projects.title: Hive board game in C++
description: Developed the Hive board game in C++ with a robust object-oriented architecture.
Built an interactive Qt interface for a smooth user experience.
projects.details:
1. Used several design patterns (Factory, Strategy, Observer, etc.) to structure game logic and facilitate extension.
2. Modeled pieces and rules precisely using a class hierarchy respecting SOLID principles.
3. Implemented Hive connectivity checking with graph traversal algorithms.
4. Maintained clear separation of game engine and interface through optimized architecture.
5. Designed a dynamic Qt interface supporting user events, animations, and live board updates.

projects.title: Search engine for ADIT newsletters
description: Designed and implemented a Python search engine for a corpus of ADIT newsletters, with spell checking, lemmatization, inverted indexing, and a graphical web interface.
projects.details:
1. Cleaned HTML corpus and transformed into structured XML with meticulous metadata extraction.
2. Built an anti-dictionary based on tf-idf scores, reinforced by statistical analysis (Zipf-Mandelbrot law).
3. Optimized indexing via spaCy lemmatization and entity normalization with Levenshtein distance.
4. Processed natural language queries using pattern analysis and conversion to JSON.
5. Delivered an interactive Dash web interface, with sorting by relevance/date and search engine evaluated by precision, recall, and F1-score.

projects.title: Financial market prediction tool
description: Developed an intelligent portfolio management platform combining mathematical optimization, market prediction, and automated decisions based on user risk profiles.
projects.details:
1. Integrated machine learning models (Random Forest, LSTM, ARIMA) to forecast price movements with cross-validation.
2. Enabled manual/automatic portfolio management with dynamic allocation every 5 minutes.
3. Computed key performance metrics (return, volatility, Sharpe ratio) and optimized allocations via scipy.optimize.
4. Delivered a reactive Dash interface with real-time management, risk alerts, and analytics.
5. Ensured system robustness via modular architecture, caching, backup, and robust error management.

projects.title: Pokémon RAG system
description: Developed a Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) system specializing in Pokémon, merging structured data from PokéAPI and unstructured articles from Poképedia with an interactive Streamlit interface.
projects.details:
1. Merged textual and structured data with cleaning/filtering and document indexing for optimal performance.
2. Full object-oriented design: system encapsulated in a dedicated RAGSystem class, applying SOLID.
3. Vector database via ChromaDB for passage indexing, multi-mode response, and auto-cleanup.
4. Streamlit interface allowing temperature parameter adjustment, passage highlighting, hallucination detection, and integrated evaluator.
5. Fine-grained evaluation: RAGAS, faithfulness/context relevance/internal metrics, mode comparisons, and improvements (hybrid search, dataset enrichment, prompt tuning).

projects.title: Driving school management site
description: Built a full-stack PHP/MySQL web app for managing students, sessions, and registrations, equipped with a modern responsive interface.
projects.details:
- Security via prepared statements, server-side validation, and granular error handling.
- Dark, animated, and responsive design for smooth user experience.
- Complete management: registration/verification, grade tracking, integrated calendar.
- Robust relational database with integrity checks and capacity management.
- Advanced features: unregistration, session validation, dynamic data previews.
